articles.author: Mark Bustos
articles.title: Ocean Oil Spills Photooxidizes Much Faster Than Previously Thought - Science Times
articles.description: The oil left in the oceans from oil spills is photo oxidized and turned into more persistent compounds in a span of hours to days, much faster than previously thought.
articles.content:
The oil left in the oceans from oil spills is photo oxidized and turned into more persistent compounds in a span of hours to days, much faster than extended periods of time as previously thought.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Mars on Earth: Turkish lake may hold clues to ancient life on planet - Prothom Alo English
articles.description: As NASA's rover Perseverance explores the surface of Mars, scientists hunting for signs of ancient life on the distant planet are using data gathered on a mission much closer to home at a lake in southwest Turkey
articles.content:
"Salda ... will serve as a powerful analogue in which we can learn and interrogate," Thomas Zurbuchen, NASA associate administrator for science, told Reuters.
